content: st around 30sts place safety eyes between rnds 33 and 34 with 4sts showing between them round 37 single_crochet into each of the first 3sts decrease *single_crochet into each of the next 3sts decrease repeat from * around 24sts round 38 single_crochet into each of the first 2sts decrease *single_crochet into each of the next 2sts decrease repeat from * around 18sts round 39 single_crochet into the first st decrease *single_crochet into the next st decrease repeat from * around 12sts round 40 decrease around 6sts fasten_off leaving a tail attach a darning needle to the tail and weave it through the front loops only of each of the remaining 6sts and pull tight to close the hole hide the loose end ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ optional nose take a length of skin tone yarn and weave it back and forth several times over 3 stitches between and just below the eyes as pictured if you start and end in the same place it s easy to fasten_off and hide the loose ends in the head i use this technique when i make the eyelashes on my dolls and you can see it here in this video on the weebee and friends youtube channel ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ important information as you work try the cap & garments on your doll to check the fit if it is working up too large try it again going down a hook size or two if it is working up too small try it again going up a hook size or two things can work up differently due to chosen yarn brand and weight - different brands can differ vastly and even different colours in the same brand can work up differently your chosen hook size and your own personal gauge/gauge will also effect how an item works up your personal gauge/gauge can even change from hour to hour e g if you make something wide awake vs when you re tired the difference a hook size can make can be amazing and makes these patterns very flexible feel free to work more or less repeat row or rounds too to make garments longer or shorter i e these are row and rounds that have the same amount of stitches that you work to simply increase the length of something ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ hair cap this hair cap is worked from the top down in joined rounds at the end of each round join the last stitch to the first stitch with a slip_stitch round 1 magic_ring ch1 not a st from now on work 8hdc join as above 8sts round 2 ch1 work 2hdc into each st around join 16sts round 3 ch1 half_double_crochet into the first st work 2hdc into the next st *half_double_crochet into the next st work 2hdc into the next st repeat from * around join 24sts rnds 4+ ch1 half_double_crochet into each st around join 24sts repeat round 4 until the cap fits on dolls head as pictured i worked a total of 6 rounds
